bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Though it seems to be heading in a different direction and it is still lacking, this update brings it closer to scidavis, in terms of functionality.
Also, Anitya seems to be monitoring sourceforge.net[1] for new versions, but upstream is hosting all their newer releases on kde.org[2],[3], so you might want to tweak that a bit.
[1] https://release-monitoring.org/project/1532/ [2] http://download.kde.org/stable/labplot/2.3.0/labplot-2.3.0-kf5.tar.xz.mirrorlist [3] http://download.kde.org/stable/labplot/2.3.0/labplot-2.3.0.tar.xz.mirrorlist

Will do.
I have been meaning to update anitya but keep forgetting.
Thanks for ping,
*** Bug 1384280 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed anitya.
submitted updates for F25 and F24. Please test and post feedback.
I downloaded version 2.3.0-3 about three days ago, but haven't got round to testing it thoroughly, we're having a bit of an earthquake trouble over here. Will check it out ASAP.

(In reply to Alexander Ploumistos from comment #4) > I downloaded version 2.3.0-3 about three days ago, but haven't got round to > testing it thoroughly, we're having a bit of an earthquake trouble over > here. Will check it out ASAP.
No worries.
I am going to be absent myself for a few days to take care of some personal stuff.
Will act on any issues when I am back.
LabPlot-2.3.0-6.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-f158654176
LabPlot-2.3.0-6.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-de071986fc

LabPlot-2.3.0-6.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
